content: If a car is traveling at a constant speed of 50 miles per hour, how long will it take to cover a distance of 375 miles?

To find out how long it will take for a car traveling at a constant speed of 50 miles per hour to cover a distance of 375 miles, you can use the formula for time, which is:

\[ \text{time} = \frac{\text{distance}}{\text{speed}} \]

Plugging in the given values:

\[ \text{time} = \frac{375 \text{ miles}}{50 \text{ miles per hour}} \]

\[ \text{time} = 7.5 \text{ hours} \]

So, it will take 7.5 hours to cover the distance at that constant speed.
